definitions.text: extend in scope or range or area
examples: The law was extended to all citizens
widen the range of applications
broaden your horizon
Extend your backyard

definitions.text: stretch out over a distance, space, time, or scope; run or extend between two points or beyond a certain point
examples: Service runs all the way to Cranbury
His knowledge doesn't go very far
My memory extends back to my fourth year of life
The facts extend beyond a consideration of her personal assets

definitions.text: span an interval of distance, space or time
examples: The war extended over five years
The period covered the turn of the century
My land extends over the hills on the horizon
This farm covers some 200 acres
The Archipelago continues for another 500 miles
extend a loan
The bank offers a good deal on new mortgages
He held out his hand
point a finger
extend a hand
the bee exserted its sting
The awning extends several feet over the sidewalk
extend my greetings
He offered his sympathy

definitions.text: extend one's limbs or muscles, or the entire body
examples: Stretch your legs!
Extend your right arm above your head
The King extended his rule to the Eastern part of the continent

definitions.text: lengthen in time; cause to be or last longer
examples: We prolonged our stay
She extended her visit by another day
The meeting was drawn out until midnight

definitions.text: extend or stretch out to a greater or the full length
examples: Unfold the newspaper
stretch out that piece of cloth
extend the TV antenna

definitions.text: cause to move at full gallop
examples: Did you gallop the horse just now?
Can we extend the legs of this dining table?

definitions.text: use to the utmost; exert vigorously or to full capacity
examples: He really extended himself when he climbed Kilimanjaro
Don't strain your mind too much

definitions.text: prolong the time allowed for payment of
examples: extend the loan
The civil war carried into the neighboring province
The disease extended into the remote mountain provinces

definitions.text: increase in quantity or bulk by adding a cheaper substance
examples: stretch the soup by adding some more cream
extend the casserole with a little rice
